channel.title: Port Problems!
channel.description: every time i use a Galkons Client base, i always get a null port, how would i change this to 43594?

item.title: Port Problems!
item.dc:creator: @MasterHelper MasterHelper
item.description:
@MasterHelper wrote:

[quote=“vato, post:3, topic:201273”]same problem…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 18, 2008, 10:35:23 PM[/size][hr]i got this…

public static final void main(String args[])
{
    try
    {
        anInt957 = 0;
        anInt958 = 0;
        method52(false);//highmem
        aBoolean959 = true;//members
        signlink.storeid = 32;
        signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());
        client client1 = new client();
        client1.method1(503, false, 765);
        setserver(args[0], "43594");[/quote]

That’s the void for a webclient use.
If you find args anywhere else it should be the port.
Or search “server ip”.
That’s all I can tell you

Read full topic

item.title: Port Problems!

item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Well, tell Galkon it was unwise to use someone else’s client as a base.
See where fucking laziness gets you?

item.description:

same problem…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 18, 2008, 10:35:23 PM[/size][hr]i got this…

public static final void main(String args[])
{
    try
    {
        anInt957 = 0;
        anInt958 = 0;
        method52(false);//highmem
        aBoolean959 = true;//members
        signlink.storeid = 32;
        signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());
        client client1 = new client();
        client1.method1(503, false, 765);
        setserver(args[0], "43594");
